paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Mutilla luxuriosa Cameron, 1897: 67
, ♀ ( Ceylon [= Sri Lanka ], specifically Trincomali [= Trincomalee] because most of the material collected by Yerbury originates from this place) [Oxford University Museum of Natural History, Oxford, UK ], nom. praeocc. non Smith, 1879 , objectively invalid name;
André 1902: 40
.

Trogaspidia saussurei Lelej, 2005: 101
;
Pagliano et al . 2020: 290
. Replacement name for
Mutilla luxuriosa Cameron, 1897
. Secondary junior homonym in
Trogaspidia
, non
Trogaspidia saussurei Olsoufieff, 1938
, currently in the genus
Chrysotilla Bischoff, 1920
. According to Article 59.2 of ICZN (1999),
Eotrogaspidia saussurei ( Lelej, 2005 )
is a valid specific name.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description . MALE (hitherto unknown). Body length: 8.0– 10.4 mm . Forewing length: 6.4–8.0 mm.

Color and setae . Black with metasomal T1–6 and S2–6 ferruginous, S1, S7, S8 brownish. Frons, lateral and basal area of clypeus, with silvery, dense, subappressed setae; gena with silvery, dense, erect and subappressed setae; base of mandible and vertex with silvery dense appressed and sparse long erect setae; vertex behind ocelli with silvery dense recumbent and sparse long erect brownish setae; scape with silvery sparse long recumbent and erect setae; pedicel, F1 inside and F2 inside with silvery dense appressed pubescence, outside with sparse recumbent short setae; F2–11 with white dense pubescence; pronotum dorsally with sparse erect whitish and blackish setae; mesopleuron with silvery dense recumbent and sparse erect setae; mesoscutum, mesoscutellum and tegula (anteriorly and mesally) with black recumbent setae; propleuron, lateral area of metanotum and dorsum of propodeum with grayish, sparse, appressed setae with not hidden sculpture; posterior and lateral propodeal slope with grayish, sparse, erect setae; legs with whitish, dense, suberect setae. Metasomal terga with golden appressed and subappressed setae, forming fringe on T1–6, sterna with sparse subappressed and erect yellow-gray setae, forming fringe on S2–6. T2 with lateral felt line, S2 without lateral felt line.

Structure . Relation of head width and mesosoma width including tegula about 64:75. Mandible bidentate at apex, without subbasal tooth on inner border and with dorsal carina extending from base to subapical tooth; outer margin beneath with large subbasal tooth. Clypeus concave shiny, raised and sculptured madiobasally. Scape slightly curved, beneath shiny, with two obscure carinae, F1 strongly compressed, wider than F2, F1 length 1.5 × F2; antennal scrobe dorsally carinate. Ocelli small, POD:OOD = 0.61. Distance between outer ocellar margins 0.93 × distance between posterior ocelli and dorsoposterior occipital border. Frons, vertex and gena with dense separated punctures, frons with interspaces setose, vertex with interspaces simple.

Notauli and parapsids developed but not touching anterior border of mesoscutum.Tegula large, blackish, smooth and shiny with few punctures anteriorly and mesally. Mesoscutellum convex with medial longitudinal carina ending by obtuse tubercle. Metanotum densely punctate, with medial chagrined narrow area. Pronotum with moderately fine, confluent punctures; mesopleuron with dense punctures; mesoscutum and mesoscutellum with moderately coarse, somewhat confluent punctures; propleuron transversally striate; inferior portions of metapleuron glabrous. Mesopleuron beneath with precoxal smooth, swollen area. Metacoxa mesally carinated, beneath flattened, with dense erect microsetae; procoxa beneath with smooth area; mesocoxa beneath with oblique carina. Propodeum reticulate, with larger cells dorsally; anterodorsally with large medial longitudinal and lateral transversal cells.

Forewings fuscous, submarginal cell 1 large, approximately equal in length to marginal cell; submarginal cell 2 receiving recurrent vein at midpoint; submarginal cell 3 less distinct than submarginal cell 2 and receiving recurrent vein in apical third.

Longitudinal carina on S1 well developed, 3/4 × as long as S 1 in profile. T1–6 and posterior halves of S3–6 with moderately fine, well separated punctures, much sparser on T2 disc; S2 with moderately coarse, separated punctures; S7 with lateral tubercle; S8 (hypopygium) laterally with longitudinal carina oriented mesally, 1/2 × as long as S 8 in profile; T7 with moderately coarse, dense punctures; T7 medially with narrow widened apically shiny area. Paramere down-curved posteriorly with pointed apex; inner margin of paramere dorsally with row of short erect golden setae; parapenial lobe large, rounded; cuspis long lamelliform, apex rounded, clearly surpassing apex of penis valve, ventrally with dense long erect golden setae; digitus stick-like setose, much shorter than cuspis; paracuspis stick-like setose, shorter than digitus; penis valves weakly asymmetrical, right penis valve slightly longer that left, with posterior ventral hook; left valve with ventral apical hook.

Material examined .

Distribution. India *: Karnataka , Kerala , Puducherry , Tamil Nadu . Sri Lanka : Amparai*, Anuradhapura*, Colombo*, Hambantota*, Jaffna*, Kandy*, Mannar*, Monaragala*, Polonnaruwa*, Ratnapura*, Trincomalee ( Cameron 1897 ).
Remarks. Both sexes of this species were collected at the same place in Sri Lanka (Mannar District, Ma Villu) in the same collecting event.
